== Introduction ==
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <nowiki>[[File:libyan_team_logo_source.png]]</nowiki>
|}
 This page is intended to be the Ubuntu GNU/Linux Local Community LOCO Libyan team page. This page should help distribute and increase the knowledge of GNU/Linux and open source software, and show how it is becoming a key player in the IT market for personal and professional use. Everyone is a key player in this LOCO team for the development of GNU/Linux in Libya, and to expand the use and assist in the migration to open source power.

 Our purpose as a team from now on is to market the abilities of Ubuntu as a powerful operating system and help people in migrating from other operating systems. We will conduct frequent trainings on how to use Linux, stressing its ease of use.  We will also make installation festivals every six months following each new release.

== Contact ==

 We can be contacted any time through :
 {*} Our mailing list <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-ly|mailing list]]</nowiki> 

 {*} Our irc channel: irc.freenode.net:8001 and joining the #ubuntu-ly channel. 

 {*} Our forum on <nowiki>[[http://libya.ubuntuforums.org|Libya Team Forum]]</nowiki>. 

 {*} You may also contact any of the admins at: m.ayad at libyalinux.com for any help.

== How to join ==

 just join our <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-ly|mailing list]]</nowiki> and add your self to the <nowiki>[[LibyaTeam-members| Members list]]</nowiki> then request an add to the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/people/libyalocoteam|launchpad]]</nowiki>. And then you will be a member of our team, congrats!

== How to Contribute ==

 {*} First of all join our mailing list.

 {*} Find a micro group in your area.

 {*} Try to attend the meetings which will be conducted over irc or in person. Follow the mailing list for information.

 {*} Discuss all your ideas freely.

== Projects ==

 Our most important task at the current time is to introduce GNU/Linux, specifically Ubuntu to the as many people as possible in the Libyan community.  We will achieve this by distributing large amounts of Ubuntu master CDs.

== Goals for year 2010 ( Update ) ! ==

 {*} Ubuntu install fest traget 1000 visitors.

 {*} Become an Approved LoCo team.

 {*} Being mentioned in the media as Ubuntu and as a LOCO team. 

 {*} Be able to switch 100 persons at least by the end of this year to Ubuntu.

 {*} Start Linux trainings on a professional level.

== News ==
  {*} Libya LoCoTeam have Ubuntu 9.10 Karmic Koala release party, on 30th Of Oct 2009 Tripoli Libya in  <nowiki>[[http://www.zumithotel.com/en/|Zumit Hotel- Old City]]</nowiki> more information about this release party please find <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ly/ubutnu-karmic-koala-910-release-party-libya-tripoli.htm | Here]]</nowiki>

{*} 12th of  Nov 2009 Libya LoCoTeam have the First open discussion about new ubuntu 9.10 feature and discussion Pros and Cons and share out experice with new Ubuntu release<nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ly/1st-discussion-ubuntu-libya-locoteam-lydiscussion0919nov.htm|More about this discussion]]</nowiki>

{*} During the week of Dec 6th-12th, the Ubuntu Libya LoCoTeam participated in a Science and Information Technology Expo at the Al-Fateh University in Tripoli Libya.<nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ly/litg-expo-2009.htm|Full report here]]</nowiki>.
The exhibition was organized by Libya Information Technology group. Throughout the event,  we distributed around 500 Ubuntu desktop CD's.  The team gave presentations to raise awareness about our group and to explain the Ubuntu operating system along with it's features. We also hosted workshops as well. Most of those who attended were students and they were quite interested in Ubuntu.

A positive result of the exhibition was that the LocoTeam had approximately 50 inquires about joining our group. 
Picturs <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ly/pictures-litg-expo-2009|WOW]]</nowiki>
